english: lotus root; lotus rhizome; lotus tuber; edible rhizome

etymology.interpretation: 艸 flags a plant-related meaning, fitting an edible plant rhizome. 耦 supplies the ǒu sound (sharing OC *ŋoːʔ), and its sense of coupling loosely echoes the knotted, segment-like joints of lotus rhizomes.

parts.english: pair; couple; yoked; to plow in pairs

examples.chinese: 今天的凉拌藕片很爽脆(今天的涼拌藕片很爽脆)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān de liángbàn ǒupiàn hěn shuǎngcuì.
examples.english: Today's chilled lotus-root slices are very crisp.

examples.chinese: 我妈妈用藕炖排骨(我媽媽用藕燉排骨)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ māma yòng ǒu dùn páigǔ.
examples.english: My mom stews pork ribs with lotus root.

examples.chinese: 市场上有新鲜的莲藕(市場上有新鮮的蓮藕)。
examples.pinyin: Shìchǎng shàng yǒu xīnxiān de lián'ǒu.
examples.english: There is fresh lotus root at the market.
